BT2025003_syn_1:

Event: Severe bronchospasm/desat at 45 activations.
Action: Procedure paused. Rx: Albuterol, Mg, Solu-Medrol.
Outcome: Sats improved. No intubation needed.
Plan: Admit pulmonary floor. Close monitoring.
BT2025003_syn_2:
PROCEDURE: Bronchial Thermoplasty (Left Lower Lobe).
COMPLICATION: The procedure was complicated by moderate intra-operative bronchospasm after 45 activations. The patient desaturated to 88%. The procedure was paused. Pharmacologic rescue with nebulized albuterol, IV magnesium, and IV methylprednisolone was successful in restoring baseline saturation without the need for invasive ventilation.
DISPOSITION: The patient was admitted to the pulmonary floor for close observation.

BT2025003:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 2 treating left lower lobe.
Patient: [REDACTED], 39-year-old female with severe persistent asthma and recent prednisone-dependent exacerbations.
Sedation: Moderate sedation with midazolam and fentanyl; native airway with high-flow nasal cannula.
Procedure details: Flexible bronchoscopy performed via the oropharynx. The thermoplasty catheter was advanced to segmental and subsegmental left lower lobe bronchi. Forty-five activations were delivered; the procedure was briefly paused because of increased airway resistance and wheeze.
Complications: Moderate intra-procedural bronchospasm with transient desaturation to 88% managed with inhaled albuterol, IV magnesium, and IV methylprednisolone. No intubation was required and saturations returned to baseline.
Disposition: Observed overnight on the pulmonary floor with scheduled bronchodilators and systemic steroids.
